title: Job Openings at J3 Holdings
content:
J3 is an FMCG distributor. We have been in existence over 8 years. J3 has branches in several locations; Lagos, Ibadan, Ogun, Ondo, and Osun state.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Bookkeeper 

Job Location: Iyana Ipaja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

 Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Record Financial Transactions: Maintain and update financial records, including purchases, sales, receipts, and payments.
	Manage Accounts: Oversee accounts payable and receivable, ensuring timely processing of invoices and payments.
	Reconcile Accounts: Regularly reconcile bank statements and financial discrepancies to ensure accuracy.
	Prepare Financial Reports: Generate monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements and reports for management review.
	Ensure Compliance: Adhere to legal and regulatory requirements related to financial reporting and tax obligations.
	Assist with Payroll: Process payroll and ensure accurate tax withholdings and reporting.
	Utilize Accounting Software: Proficiently use accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, FreshBooks) to manage financial data and generate reports.


Application Closing Date: 25th February, 2026.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: midaasconsult@gmail.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.

Note


	For more enquiries, send a WhatsApp message to:09152781100.


 

 

2.) Warehouse Supervisor 1

Job Location: Iyana Ipaja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Warehouse Supervisor oversees inventory management, timely loading/unloading of goods, stock accuracy, coordination with sales and logistics teams, and ensures order, cleanliness, and safety within the warehouse.


Key Responsibilities
Inventory / Stock Management:


	Maintain accurate stock records using manual or digital tools.
	Conduct daily stock counts and reconcile physical vs. system records.
	Enforce FIFO (First-In, First-Out) and FEFO (First Expiry, First-Out) principles.
	Report low stock levels and coordinate restocking.
	Identify and report slow-moving stock to prevent expiry.
	Ensure all inventory activities follow the company’s SOPs and stock handling guidelines.
	Conduct regular stock checks and cycle counts to detect discrepancies.
	Assist in stock audits and ensure supporting documents are filed and available for review.
	Oversee proper storage practices: product labeling, stacking, and safe handling (especially for perishables).
	Coordinate preparation and ensure the accuracy of all stock-related documents (e.g., GRNs, waybills, delivery notes).
	Report stock variances, damages, or shortages to the Head of Warehouse Operations, with root cause analysis and suggested resolutions.
	Submit daily and weekly performance and stock reports to the Head of Warehouse.


Salary
N90,000 / month. 

Application Closing Date: 28th February, 2026.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: midaasconsult@gmail.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.

Note: For more information, contact onWhatsApp 09152781100.

 

 

3.) Van Sales Representative, 101

Job Location: Berger, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Vehicle Sales Representative is responsible for generating sales, building customer relationships, and ensuring excellent customer service while meeting dealership sales goals.
	The role involves guiding customers through the vehicle purchase process, from initial inquiry to final delivery.


Responsibilities


	Greet and engage customers, identify their needs, and recommend suitable vehicles.
	Explain product features, specifications, pricing, financing options, and warranties.
	Conduct test drives and demonstrate vehicle performance.
	Negotiate sales terms and close deals to meet or exceed monthly targets.
	Process sales paperwork and ensure compliance with dealership and regulatory requirements.
	Maintain knowledge of current inventory, new product launches, promotions, and industry trends.
	Follow up with prospects and previous customers to generate repeat and referral business.
	Build and maintain strong customer relationships for long-term satisfaction and loyalty.
	Collaborate with finance and service departments to provide a seamless customer experience.


Requirements


	Interested candidates shouldI should possess an SSCE / NECO / GCE or OND with 2-4 years of experience as a sales representative.


Salary
N100,000 per month.

Application Closing Date: 28th February, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: midaasconsult@gmail.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.

Note: For more information, contact on WhatsApp 09152781100.

title: Job Vacancies at Ajoke Group
content:
Ajoke Group is a distribution company that deals with the supply of major FMCG's products nationwide.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Audit Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Conduct audits of sales, collections, receivables, and credit notes across routes, depots, and distributors
	Verify inventory records including stock receipts, transfers, breakages, expiries, and returns
	Audit warehouse and delivery operations to ensure proper stock handling and documentation
	Review cash handling, bank deposits, and reconciliation of daily sales collections
	Evaluate internal controls over pricing, discounts, promotions, and free-of-charge (FOC) items
	Ensure compliance with company policies, statutory regulations, and tax requirements
	Perform route, outlet, and distributor audits to detect variances, leakages, or irregularities
	Analyze audit findings and prepare clear audit reports with recommendations
	Follow up on corrective actions and report unresolved issues to management
	Support fraud risk assessments and investigation activities when required
	Assist management in strengthening processes and operational efficiency.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess an OND or Bachelor's Degree with 1 - 2 years ofexperience.


Application Closing Date: 23rd January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment.asl@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Accountant

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Maintain books of accounts and ensure accuracy of financial records
	Record daily financial transactions including sales, purchases, and expenses
	Prepare and reconcile bank, cash, and supplier accounts
	Monitor accounts receivable and payable
	Prepare monthly financial statements and management reports
	Handle invoicing, credit notes, and debit notes
	Support inventory accounting and stock reconciliations
	Ensure compliance with tax, regulatory, and company policies
	Assist in budgeting and cost control activities
	Coordinate with auditors and provide required documentation
	Maintain proper filing of financial records and supporting documents


Application Closing Date: 30th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment.asl@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Warehouse Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Receive incoming stocks and verify quantities, batch numbers, and expiry dates
	Ensure proper storage of beverages in accordance with FIFO/FEFO principles
	Maintain accurate inventory records in the system and physical stock
	Coordinate loading and dispatch of goods based on delivery schedules
	Monitor stock levels and report shortages, damages, and expiries
	Control and document returns, breakages, and expired products
	Ensure cleanliness, safety, and proper organization of the warehouse
	Supervise warehouse helpers and loaders as required
	Ensure proper documentation for receipts, transfers, and dispatches
	Coordinate with sales, logistics, and finance teams for smooth operations
	Enforce compliance with company policies and safety standards
	Support periodic stock counts and reconciliations.


Application Closing Date: 23rd January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment.asl@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

     

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Openings at PWAN Unique
content:
PWAN Uniqueis a leading real estate investment and network marketing company in Nigeria, dedicated to providing affordable housing solutions and lucrative investment opportunities. With branches within and outside Lagos, we pride ourselves on excellence, integrity, and customer satisfaction.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Driver

Job Location: Asaba, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Ensure that all assigned vehicles are always clean and in good condition.
	Convey staff, clients and supplies from one place to another
	Ensure the driver's log is always filled when proceeding on any assignment.
	Comply with the company rules, regulations, and policies.
	Comply with the traffic regulations
	Routinely check the condition of the vehicle to ensure that everything is in working order.
	Ensure that the company’s vehicles are safely and comfortably driven by observing defensive driving while on the road to prevent accidents.
	Report any vehicle malfunctions or needed repairs
	Prepare and submit reports that may include the number of clients or trips, hours worked, mileage, fuel consumption.
	Report delays, accidents, or other traffic and transportation situations.


Requirements


	Minimum of SSCE
	Minimum of 3 years of experience
	Must be familiar with various routes in Asaba, Delta state
	Must know how to drive maual and automatic vehicles
	Must have a valid driver's license.


Application Closing Date: 28th February, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrpwanunique@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Accountant

Job Location: Jakande- Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
Responsibilities


	Prepare and issue official receipts for all payments received.
	Calculate and process commissions due to sales executives, agents, and partners.
	Maintain accurate books of accounts, ledgers, and financial statements.
	Oversee accounts payable and receivable activities.
	Conduct bank reconciliations and monitor daily cash flow.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports.
	Ensure compliance with tax laws and company policies.
	Support budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning activities.
	Collaborate with external auditors and regulatory bodies as required.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting
	2 - 4 years of relevant accounting experience, preferably in the real estate sector.
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., Sage, QuickBooks, or similar)
	Professional certification (ICAN, ACCA) is an added advantage.
	High attention to detail, integrity, and strong organizational skills.


Salary
N250,000 - N270,000 per month. 

Application Closing Date: 15th February, 2026

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrpwanunique@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Legal Officer

Job Location: Jakande - Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities


	Monitor legal risk in real estate documentation and advise clients accordingly
	Develop and inspect land surveying projects
	Advise the company on title issues, environmental issues, and insurance issues
	Represent the company in court, participate in trials and hearings, file appeals, and draft documents and legal pleadings
	Ensure that appropriate approvals are in place before real estate transactions are executed


Job Specification


	Interested candidates should have a Bachelor's Degree (LL.B)
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in real estate law and industry knowledge that includes litigation, property management, and purchase and sale transactions.


Salary
N250,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 31st January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrpwanunique@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Branch Manager (Microfinance) Job at Bridgemead HR. and Advisory




        
    

        
        Bridgemead HR provides customized HR solutions to optimize workforce productivity and profitability. Our expert trainers design bespoke training programs, innovative HR strategies, and efficient payroll systems tailored to each client’s unique needs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Branch Manager (Microfinance)
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	The Branch Manager is responsible for providing strategic leadership and operational oversight for the branch, ensuring profitability, compliance, and service excellence.
	This role drives business growth through effective marketing, risk management, and customer relationship development while maintaining high standards of performance and integrity in line with the bank’s mission and regulatory requirements.
	Develop and execute branch business strategies to achieve set financial targets.
	Drive deposit mobilization, credit growth, and revenue diversification initiatives.
	Expand the branch’s customer base and market share through proactive marketing and partnerships.
	Promote cross-selling of bank products and services to enhance customer value.
	Supervise loan processing, disbursement, monitoring, and recovery activities.
	Maintain a healthy loan portfolio by ensuring PAR (Portfolio at Risk) remains below 5%.
	Enforce compliance with credit policies, risk assessment standards, and CBN regulations.
	Identify, evaluate, and mitigate operational and credit risks across branch activities.
	Oversee all daily branch operations, including cash management, account opening, and service delivery.
	Ensure strict adherence to AML/CFT, KYC, and other regulatory and internal control standards.
	Implement and monitor operational policies to ensure efficiency and accountability.
	Liaise with auditors, regulators, and stakeholders to maintain a positive compliance record.
	Lead, coach, and develop branch staff to achieve individual and team performance goals.
	Conduct regular team meetings to review targets, performance gaps, and improvement plans.
	Support HR processes including recruitment, onboarding, appraisal, and discipline.
	Foster a culture of teamwork, accountability, and continuous improvement.
	Ensure excellent customer service delivery and prompt resolution of complaints.
	Build and sustain strong relationships with key customers and community stakeholders.
	Track branch financial performance and prepare timely weekly and monthly reports.
	Analyze variances and recommend corrective actions to achieve set goal.
